required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise,Metabolic Syndrome and Weight Regain (Echocardiography Substudy)
clinical_study.official_title: Exercise in Patients With Metabolic Syndrome and Weight Regain - Echocardiography Substudy

brief_summary.textblock: We plan to test the hypothesis that patients with metabolic syndrome will have impaired left ventricular diastolic parameters. These parameters will be measured before and after a stress test at the end of a 3 month period of exercise training and a 10% weight loss.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients must have 2 of the 5 criteria for metabolic syndrome and be able to exercise in a monitored setting for 45 min 5 times a week.

primary_outcome.description: E/E' is an echocardiographic parameter where E = early mitral inflow velocity and E' = early diastolic mitral annular motion. Measured in all participants prior to treadmill stress test.
E/E' is an echocardiographic parameter where E = early mitral inflow velocity and E' = early diastolic mitral annular motion. Measured in all participants immediately following treadmill stress test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Resting Maximal Oxygen Uptake (VO2 Max)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of the maximum volume of oxygen that a body is capable of utilizing in one minute, measured in milliliters per kilogram of body weight per minute (ml/kg/min). Measured in all participants prior to treadmill stress test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Maximal Oxygen Uptake (VO2 Max)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of the maximum volume of oxygen that a body is capable of utilizing in one minute, measured in milliliters per kilogram of body weight per minute (ml/kg/min) Measured in all participants immediately following treadmill stress test.

arm_group.description: Echocardiography was performed prior to and within 60 seconds of completing the standard Bruce treadmill protocol.

intervention.description: Echocardiography was performs prior to and within 60 seconds of completing the standard Bruce treadmill protocol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 2 of 5 criteria for metabolic syndrome
- Ability to exercise for 45 min 5 days a week
Exclusion Criteria:
- No diabetes
- Established coronary disease

results_reference.citation: Chockalingam A, Linden MA, Dellsperger KC, Thomas TR. Correlation of Normal Diastolic Cardiac Function With VO in the Metabolic Syndrome. Prev Cardiol. 2009 Summer;12(3):163-8. doi: 10.1111/j.1751-7141.2009.00027.x.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited as part of the parent study on Weight Regain (PI Tom Thomas) funded by NIH. These patients were recruited from clinics, volunteers from advertisements. Patients needed to have 2 of 5 criteria for the Metabolic Syndrome (MetS) plus have obesity.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All patients in this study had successfully been screened as part of the parent study. All patients were to exercise (aerobic) and have a 10% weight loss. Echocardiography was performed prior to and immediately following a maximal stress test at the end of 12 weeks of exercise.

group.title: Stress Echocardiography
group.description: Echocardiography was performed prior to and within 60 seconds of completing the standard Bruce treadmill protocol.

group.title: Stress Echocardiography
group.description: Patients completed 3 months of training with 10% weight loss. At the end of that study, they were subjected to pre- and post-stress echocardiography to evaluate E/E' and VO2 max.

outcome.title: Mean Resting E/E'
outcome.description: E/E' is an echocardiographic parameter where E = early mitral inflow velocity and E' = early diastolic mitral annular motion. Measured in all participants prior to treadmill stress test.
outcome.population: The echo results from all subjects were analyzed at rest and following maximal exercise testing.

group.title: Stress Echocardiography
group.description: Echocardiogram E/E' measured before and after exercise

measure.title: Mean Resting E/E'
measure.description: E/E' is an echocardiographic parameter where E = early mitral inflow velocity and E' = early diastolic mitral annular motion. Measured in all participants prior to treadmill stress test.
measure.population: The echo results from all subjects were analyzed at rest and following maximal exercise testing.

analysis.groups_desc: Pearson Product correlation was used to determine relationships between resting E/E' and Exercise VO2 max and Stress E/E' and Exercise VO2max.

outcome.title: Post-exercise E/E'
outcome.description: E/E' is an echocardiographic parameter where E = early mitral inflow velocity and E' = early diastolic mitral annular motion. Measured in all participants immediately following treadmill stress test.
outcome.population: The echo results from all subjects were analyzed at rest and following maximal exercise testing.

measure.title: Post-exercise E/E'
measure.description: E/E' is an echocardiographic parameter where E = early mitral inflow velocity and E' = early diastolic mitral annular motion. Measured in all participants immediately following treadmill stress test.
measure.population: The echo results from all subjects were analyzed at rest and following maximal exercise testing.

outcome.title: Mean Resting Maximal Oxygen Uptake (VO2 Max)
outcome.description: Measure of the maximum volume of oxygen that a body is capable of utilizing in one minute, measured in milliliters per kilogram of body weight per minute (ml/kg/min). Measured in all participants prior to treadmill stress test.
outcome.population: This data, if analyzed, is unavailable as the PI/study staff left the institution before completing the analysis and without making results available.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Kevin C. Dellsperger, MD, PhD, Professor, Internal Medicine
